title: Trump's Scotland Golf Course Trip Blends Presidential Duties with Private Business Interests
summary: President Trump traveled to Scotland to open a new golf course, using official diplomatic meetings and taxpayer-funded trip to promote personal business interests, raising significant ethical concerns about conflicts of interest
description: During a five-day trip to Scotland, Trump opened a new golf course at Trump International Golf Links Aberdeen and held diplomatic meetings, simultaneously promoting his family's business and conducting official presidential duties

sources.title: Trump's Trip to Scotland as His New Golf Course Opens Blurs Politics and the Family's Business
Trump's Golf Business in Scotland and British Open Bid
Trump Opens Scotland Golf Course on Taxpayer-Funded Trip

connections: Ongoing pattern of mixing presidential duties with personal business interests
notes: Estimated taxpayer cost of trip: $10 million. Diplomatic meetings held at Trump-owned golf properties, raising significant ethical concerns.

implications.ethical_concerns: Continued blending of presidential duties with personal business promotion
implications.diplomatic_context: Trade discussions and bilateral meetings conducted at Trump-owned properties
